campaign.story:
Plantopia is a strategic card game where players harness their gardening abilities to contend for the coveted title of Plantopia’s Champion Gardener.
Join Potato and friends on their journey and enter the world of Plantopia, where you will manage a garden of unbe-LEAF-ably cute and quirky plants, and maximize their potential to grow the craziest garden on the planet!
Plantopia is based on the universe of Life of a Potato, a comic series about a little potato and its friends, spreading love, kindness and laughter around the world. It is a card game for 2-5 players and takes around 20 minutes to play (30 minutes if you're new!). You can find more information on our BGG site.
Don’t be fooled by the cuteness of the plants - get ready for the countless strategies that await you on Plantopia. The game is designed by internationally acclaimed board game designer Daryl Chow (Overbooked, The Artemis Project, Remember Our Trip, Ramen Ink etc), whose designs revolve around a framework of simple rules to bring you a wealth of interesting choices.   
The Garden City Seed Pack is only in bloom for these 25 days, and will never be in season again! Not even in your Flower Leaf Garden Stores! 
Plantopia is designed with both the casual gamer and hardcore strategist in mind. The simple and intuitive rules make it accessible for all, and friends and families will have a fun and fruitful time in Plantopia. Its fast playing time and high gardener count also makes it a great game to bring to your friends' greenhouses.
But at its core, it is a tableau-building and hand-management game where you will have to synergize the abilities of all your plants to do well. Kind of like a much cuter Race for the Galaxy with lots more plants!
The game is designed to have little to no downtime, yet the unique Weather mechanic brings players together - ignore rival gardens at your folly! You'll need to keep an eye on your fellow gardeners to claim the title of Champion Gardener for yourself.
Capitalize upon the immediate powers of the Baby Plants while harnessing the scoring combos of the Treevolved Plants. Will you go for the fast-growing Flowers, the card-drawing Cacti, or the weather-controlling Trees? Or a combination of all of the above? You’ll always find new plants and different strategies awaiting every trip you take to Plantopia.
Watch our official how-to-play video below to learn how to play Plantopia!     
PLAY

Or check out Cardboard Stacker's excellent tutorial video here:  
  If you would like to take a look at the English rulebook, it is here!
Les règles françaises sont ici.
Las reglas españolas están aquí.
日本語のルールはこちらです。
And if you want to give it a try on Tabletopia with your friends, it is here! (NOTE: cards are not the most updated version).
We had a great time at a Tabletopia Party for backers who joined us for a live playthrough of the game together with AmateurBoardgamer, you can watch the recap here: 
Plants are language-independent, and so is Plantopia. There is no text on the cards except for the puns (which admittedly is a big part of it). All you need to play Plantopia is a rulebook or video in your language.
We are finalizing a French and Spanish rulebook, and are working on a Chinese and Japanese one as well. So if you are a speaker of these languages, please look out for them in our updates!
Below are all the succulent rewards available for harvest. If you would like to add on any extra games, you may freely customize your pledge at the end of the campaign through BackerKit (even if you chose the Fertilize level).    
Help us discover more of Plantopia by unlocking the stretch goals below! Spread the seeds of board gaming joy to all your friends.
ALL BACKERS will enjoy the unlocked rewards below to their set of Plantopia at no extra charge! If the goal says 'KS exclusive', it will only be for KS backers and not included in the retail sets. 
 We've already unlocked 20 stretches, so all backers will receive at least 24 extra cards (plus a sticker pack!). You wouldn't even be able to buy the Seed Pack with a Money Tree!
   Check out all these blooming good previews:  
Cardboard Stacker review
Daily Worker Placement review
The Game Shelf review
AmateurBoardGamer review
Karn GG review
Lacopinegeek
Jugando en Pareja review
What's on the Shelf
Gameosity Review
 If you are a reviewer and are interested to feature Plantopia on your channels, you can find our press kit here.
 TEAM PLANTOPIA
Plantopia is a collaboration between Life of a Potato (from Daylight Studios) and Origame, a board game company. Plantopia's game mechanics are designed by Daryl Chow, while illustrations and creative content are by Ryu Ho, creator of Life of a Potato. Rounding out the team are Nicholas Pang, co-founder of Origame, and Alwyn Lee, founder/CEO of Daylight Studios.
Daylight Studios
Daylight Studios is a Singapore-based game development company founded in 2011, most known for the popular game series, Holy Potatoes ®, available on PC, mobile and console worldwide. Fueled by a burning passion as creators, Daylight is committed to creating wholesome original content and games with captivating storylines, lovable characters, and an endless amount of fun and joy.
Daylight Studios has recently ventured into the creation of a new comic series, Life of a Potato, aiming to spread love, kindness and positivity around the world. Life of a Potato has since organically grown a loyal potato army with more than 50K followers on Instagram from all over the world. Life of a Potato centers around the adventures of a little ordinary potato and its friends, with the hope to spread the message that no matter how small or insignificant we think we may be, we can all make a difference if we try.
Origame
Origame is a proudly Singapore-based board game publisher that aims to showcase the best of Asian culture and talent. Driven by a passion for great game mechanics and visual design, we aspire to create games that continuously improve as well as reflect our identity and tell our stories. We believe board games have the power to build relationships and communities, and hope that our games can have a cultural as well as social impact.
With partnerships all over Asia, Origame aims to build an Asian community of board game designers, social innovators, and artists to reconceptualize and redefine Asian board games. Origame is also actively engaged in fostering the board game community and culture in Singapore and beyond.

To keep fulfilments clean, we will delimit a maximum of 1 delivery location per backer, regardless of reward levels or number of copies ordered.
We will be working with experienced fulfillment partners in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, Canada, and US. 
As we find more fulfillment partners around the world, we will reduce shipping costs accordingly. Otherwise, the shipping costs reflect the reality of getting a game to your doorstep.
Shipping to areas outside of Singapore, Malaysia, Taiwan, Canada and the US may result in additional duty/taxes. Please enquire about the import tax of your country before placing an order.
Deliveries are expected to commence on 1 Dec 2020 (and hopefully reach you in time for Christmas! It's better than mistletoe!).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We know what we’re doing. In just over a year, we’ve independently designed, published, and distributed 3 board games in Asia, and during half that time a pandemic was raging. While we’re based in Singapore, our manufacturing partner in Taiwan brings an attention to detail that enables us to attain a consistent quality that board gamers expect. 

Unexpected delays may surface, especially during a global pandemic. We will do our best to minimise and mitigate this. Having published and distributed our latest game, Kopi King, during the last 5 months of lockdown and recovery, we’re applying the lessons we learnt and are confident in reaching our production milestones and standards. 

Communication is key in a project like this. We will keep you regularly updated about our progress and challenges in a clear and transparent way.

SHIPPING ADVISORY
Due to the outbreak of COVID-19, many airlines have been forced to decrease, suspend, or cancel flights. As a result, air freight capacity and frequency to many destinations have been interrupted, delayed, or suspended until further notice. 

As the global health situation evolves, please enquire about any possible service disruptions that might be affecting your country's postal operators and customs regulators before placing an order.

It's not too late. Click the image above to head to our website and pre-order the game.
PRE-ORDER LINK: https://buttonshygames.com/products/food-chain-island
On this forgotten island in a tiny corner of the ocean the animals are hungry! Your goal is to influence the wildlife - and arrange their meals - so there is only one animal left!
Food Chain Island is the next Button Shy Wallet Game, and the first in what we are calling our simply solo series. These are games that are one player only, light on rules, and big on replayability.  
Let's get into what makes Food Chain Island so awesome!
Start by shuffling the cards and making a 4X4 grid island of animals with the sea animals off to the side.  
On a turn, you must move one land animal one space in one of the four cardinal directions so it’s placed over another animal that is 1-3 numbers lower in value. In this way, you can move the ‘8’ animal over a 7, 6 or 5. 
When you do this, place the card on top of the lower card. This how an animal eats another animal.
When cards are stacked on one another, they are considered to be the number on the top. The stack of cards now moves as one.
When you move a card to eat another, you activate the ability on the card that just ate another. This special effect is mandatory and must be applied. In some cases, the ability will benefit you, and in others it will make the game harder.
The sea animals are there to help you out. At any time you may discard a sea animal and perform its special ability. Once a sea animal is used, it is discarded. 
The game ends when only one animal remains or if you are unable to eat an adjacent animal. 
If you only have one animal left, congratulations! You are an Ecological Expert.
If you have two animals left, nice job! You are an Accidental Matchmaker.
If you have three animals left, you just made it through! You are still an Island Intern. 
Otherwise, if you have 4+ animals, you have lost the game and need to keep trying.
Further Challenges
To make the game more difficult, randomly remove one or both of the sea animals. In addition, you can explore these alternate card layouts.
You can print and play the game today! The black and white version, along with unedited prototype rules is available at PNP Arcade.
LINK: https://www.pnparcade.com/products/food-chain-island-kickstarter-preview
For a complete playthrough, check out Matt Upton's video below: 
More to come as we update this image. :)
Also available here is Food Chain Island: Tough Skies, a three card expansion that will make your games just a little more challenging. At the beginning of the game, shuffle and place one card face-up into the play area. Do not use the others. During the game, you must activate, resolve and discard the air animal. The air animal must be resolved before the end of the game. For an additional challenge, use 2 or all 3 air animals.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With our method of publishing and using multiple manufacturers, there's always a chance that one part of the game could come in with an error, leading to delays. We've been able to minimize these errors in recent years, but they can happen from time to time. We've also upped our staff internally to make sure we can hit intended deadlines.

With COVID-19 some of our suppliers have been delayed, so we've been allowing additional time in our estimations and setting up backup suppliers as well. Our staff is also minimized at this time, so we are allowing additional time for a smaller staff to assemble and ship games. 

Our two unfulfilled projects are moving along according to our updated schedule. Our Universal Rule: Singularity is starting to arrive here and is on track as planned. Our Skulls of Sedlec campaign is still a month away from fulfillment, but is on track as planned.

Hello everyone! It's been quite a week for Food Chain Island. We started off with one of our largest funded first days for Button Shy, and in the end, this seems like it will be our third highest funded game on Kickstarter! 
What's funny is that it's third behind Sprawlopolis and Tussie Mussie, which are the other two games that make up our Instant Collection here. It's going to make a great trio. :)
This is also a big start to our Simply Solo line. We'll make sure to keep everyone in the loop about our next game in the line (Ugly Gryphon Inn) as well as the games that will follow. I can't wait to share more on these.

Wow, this campaign really took off. We launched exactly 48 hours ago, and here we are almost 900 backers later. That's a very healthy number for little old Button Shy, and we're happy to see where we'll go from here. Thank you all for joining us! 
Now if you'll join in our celebratory "Kickstarter is funded" meal...

 Experts in their field, years of hunting the rodents through the twisted streets of towns and cities, near and far. These mercenaries and peddlers of rodent disposal now stand on the precipice of fame and glory, all they have to do is their job, right?
OBJECTIVE
The Ratcatchers objective: To rid the city of as many rats as possible on their way to gathering as much Magical Cheese as possible.
WIN - The RATCATCHER is victorious if you achieve any one of the following criteria;
• The Ratcatcher collects 10 Magic Cheese or The Ratcatcher slays the Nemesis Rat
LOSE - The Ratcatcher is defeated if the Rats achieve one of the following criteria;
• The Rats consume 10 Magic Cheese or The Ratcatcher is reduced to 0 wounds

The Ratcatcher (Player) Turn: 
During your Ratcatchers turn, they’re seeking to vanquish rats & gather Magical Cheese. This can be done using the various skills and actions listed on the Character Board.   
Magic Cheese Tokens
Unlock/Upgrade:
Once the Ratcatcher can successfully gather some Magical Cheese then the fun of upgrading and customising your Ratcatcher can begin.  
By assigning a Magic Cheese you may unlock a chosen ability. Once active place the maximum number of the relevant tokens on the Character Board.
 The Rats (AI) Turn: 
Dependent on the type of Rat, the rats will either seek out the Magical Cheese or attack the Ratcatcher. White rats as the most numerous, and though simple in appearance their strength becomes apparent when they swarm towards pieces of cheese. Brown rats are vicious and ill tempered, set on attacking any who come close these rodents must be disposed of carefully. Black rats, are the breeders and with them comes even more rats. Each time a black rat is placed, additional rats are immediately placed. In addition to that each spawn phase Black rats count as a Spawn Point for even more rats! 
Peculiar Rats: 
The Magic Cheese can have wonderful and miraculous effects, this effect is not limited to humanity only. The rats are eating the cheese and it has had some peculiar effects on them.
The Peculiar rats imbue the power of the magic cheese forming a nasty mini boss style adversary that will complicate the Ratcatcher's quest but also offers a variety of tempting rewards should the Ratcatcher be bold enough to catch one. 
Nemesis Rats:
Nemesis Rats are true horrors of their species. The Magical Cheese has twisted their mind and body, into something spawned from the most terrible of nightmares. As catalysts of the Rat infection, destroying them is the of the utmost importance and seems the only logical path to freeing the kingdom.
Each Nemesis on top of having their own unique abilities, also has a varied Rat tracker. As the Rats collect Magic Cheese, this tracker will gain momentum, modifying the common rats, spawning Peculair rats and triggering the spawning of the Nemesis Rat. This makes each variant Nemesis a unique challenge.  
Expanding the Township:  
Township Cards - Tarot Sized Cards
The sprawling streets of Brie are the battle zone of The Ratcatcher. Filled with twists and turns it will require a keen eye to find the cheese & tactical choices to stay a head of the rat horde.  
If there are fewer than two Magic Cheese tokens in the city, then a mandatory Explore Action is undertaken. This will expand the city using additional township cards. Each new Township card will also add more cheese, opportunities to refill/recuperate & of course, more rats. 

 WHY PLEDGE NOW:
As with most projects using crowdfunding, The Ratcatcher solo adventure board game will not possible to publish without the financial commitment of backers. There are not only many costs to cover, but also the unpredictability of the market as well as gauging demand are all reasons Platypus Industries has come seeking funding via Kickstarter.
Subsidised shipping
Contribute the games content 
Unlock amazing via stretch goals such as extra content and quality upgrades for everyone!
Allow the Ratcatcher product line to get a strong start. There are plenty of plans for continued support & expansions, but only if the core set is funded.
Retailer Only

Keep track of the Ratcatcher's progress using Kicktraq
Aussie games design company set on creating top quality products that are unique, interesting & challenging.  
This is the first project to be launched by the company, but not our first game & definitely not our last. 
Matthew Aslin is the one-man show behind The Ratcatcher, Solo Adventure. He dwells in Melbourne, this is the first solo project but as with Platypus Industries it's unlikely to be his last.

Business Partners.
We are very lucky to be pairing with some amazing and very experienced companies to help us deliver our product in a way that is both high quality, swift & professional. 
Fulfilment: QML, Aetherworks, Logistico & VFI 
Manufacturing: HJM (China)
Pledge Manager:

 Alternative Languages Rules:  Currently we have a Spanish fan made rulebook. At his time I am open to establishing French & German fan based rulebooks at this stage. These will be community based rulebooks. Dependent on demand we may seek professional translation to be available with the games commercial release. 
COMMUNITY TRANSLATIONS

  FAQ - Pledging:
 Late Pledges: We will be partnering with Gamefound to assist with late Pledges, note that Late/Pledges & pre-orders will NOT have subsided shipping included. By backing at any level you will qualify for Free/subsided shipping should you choose to upgrade your pledge during the pledge manager.
 Stretch Goals: All Stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign will be included FREE of charge in every copy of The Ratcatcher. Also where applicable, stretch goals will also be added to the Print and Play pledge level.  
 Multiple copies of the game: There are two options for the purchase of multiple copies, either by pledging at any level a backer will have access to the post campaign Pledge Manager (Gamefound.com), this will allow the backer to add additional copies of the game, shipping will be calculated & charged as a bundle (so you should save a bit of money). Alternatively if you have a few fellow gamers there is the Horde pledge, which will give you a discount as well as discount shipping. Just because it's a solo game dosen't mean we can be social ;) 
FAQ - Shipping:
 What is Subsidised shipping?: This is me covering a portion of the total shipping costs. Platypus Industries will pay $10 AUD of the total shipping cost. This is a little thank you for supporting us during the Kickstarter campaign. 
 Shipping black zones: Sadly as much as it pains us to to say. There are certain locations around the world that we will NOT be able to deliver our product. Risks and challenges
World economics: firstly, we are not economists. Global economics are alway fluctuating and global event particularly around the global pandemic are making it extremely difficult to predict the condition of the market short or long term. We are well aware of this and will endeavour to work through and communicate any events or situations that effect the delivery of this game. 

Manufacturing: Communication and detailed specification have been provided to a handful of manufacturers as to get a comprehensive quote and product outline. Shipping/fulfilment: One of the most unpredictable facets of Kickstarter delivery. We will endeavour to keep everything manageable but there are plenty of elements that will be out of our control. Local & international Taxes/tariffs, freight, local currency exchange, misc costs. 
We have budgeted some safety funds in the funding goal to mitigate unexpected changes to our costs with regards fulfilment of the product.

Art & Graphics: Artwork/graphic design for the game is completed. If additional artwork is required is all done by the resident artist so there will not be any delays with any required artwork. 

Game Design & Development: the core game is locked in, but as with any crowd funding campaigns, with so many eyes on the design I’m sure there will be some great ideas and insight into the design that may need to be implemented. We will endeavour to put things in place without delaying any of the current delivery timelines.

campaign.story:
From The McLachlan Brothers, the team that brought you Fidget Cube, Storm the Gate, Fidget Factory, and more...
Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare is a frantic, handcrafted wooden tabletop dexterity game in which you must rapidly move your army of heroes into your opponent's battle camp.
The objective of Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare is simple - clear your side of the board of all tokens before your opponent can do the same.
PLAY

To begin the round, both players put one fist by their side of the board and pound their fists against the table three times. On the third time, the game begins.
Players shoot tokens from their camp into their opponent’s camp. Tokens are shot by pulling them against the bungee cord and releasing. Only one token may be shot by each player at a time.
The round ends once one player clears all tokens from their side of the board. The gate must be entirely clear (no token may be halfway through the gate).
Read The Rules
Click here to view a PDF of the current draft of Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare rules!
In the times before The Divide, the inhabitants of The Veiled Forest existed harmoniously. The seasons came and went each year, and there was peace among all creatures that made these woodlands their home.
One morning, at the very edge of the winter solstice's arrival, all of this changed.
As the sun began to shed its light on the forest, the animals living within it stirred and noticed a peculiar change to their home.
Where there was once a small grove of trees in the middle of The Veiled Forest, there now was a massive clearing - a meadow that stretched a mile long, causing a dramatic break in the thick foliage that covered the ground just hours earlier. In the center of this meadow stood a sprawling structure: a mysterious wall separating what was now the two sides of The Veiled Forest. And in the middle of the wall stood a lone gate.
Unable to resist exploring this strange new addition to the land, the creatures stepped through the gate and were immediately met with a blast of ice cold air all around - a much harsher environment from the gentle breeze that they'd just left on the other side.
Upon closer inspection, the creatures came to realize that on one side of the wall, The Veiled Forest was still experiencing the season of autumn - while on the other side, winter had already permeated the landscape.
Before they could make sense of this jarring new reality, the creatures heard movement coming toward them, from each of the two sides of The Veiled Forest. The sounds of rustling trees and the ground being trampled beneath countless animals became louder and louder. Then, out of each side of the woods and into the meadow burst two armies - each army made up of the creatures that resided in that half of the forest when the wall arrived.
These two factions hurtled toward the center of the wall, seemingly being drawn to it by a force outside of themselves. It was clear that each faction had simply one goal: to pass through the gate.
The cause of this odd, overnight transformation - now called The Divide - is unknown. Perhaps some answers will be uncovered by the inhabitants of the woodland one day. Until then, each year marking the day of The Divide, the two factions of creatures assemble in the center of The Veiled Forest. They continue to do so to battle for the chance to pass through the gate and overtake the opposing faction, in the hopes that by doing so the seasons - and their home - will return to as they once were. 
They may be adorable, but don't let their cuddly appearance fool you.
While they don't fall under any particular class or hero designation, Rabbits make up the majority of creatures in most battles and, depending on your playing style, can pack a mighty punch.
Larger than any other hero, the Brute class is determined to use its size to its advantage.
Easily send opposing forces back through to their camp in any head on collision - but be warned, fitting through the gate doesn't come as easily to these heroes.
Smaller than all other heroes, the Stealth class is capable of easily maneuvering past foes and traveling to the opponent's camp without getting caught up in the gate.
Be careful not to underestimate the importance of agility in this battle.
With so much action taking place at the gate, the Aerial class has a different plan of attack...
Why go through the gate when you can soar over it?
The only class that takes the field is Rabbits. Classic Mode is a perfect introduction to Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare, and can be enjoyed by beginners, purists, and seasoned players alike.
In between rounds, Rabbit tokens are returned to their camps, and the next round begins. The game ends once a player wins 2 rounds.
Players pledge their allegiance to either the Autumn or Winter faction.
Each player selects one Hero class from their faction to use for the first round. Once both players have chosen their first Heroes, players reveal their selections and place the designated number of Rabbit tokens and Hero tokens in their camp.
In between rounds, all tokens are cleared from the board. Each player selects a new, previously unused Hero class from their faction to use before the round begins. Players reveal their new hero selections, and place the designated number of tokens in their camp before the next round begins.
Launching each class of Heroes and Rabbits is simple and can be picked up by anyone in seconds. All tokens may only be launched using the bungee in each camp. 
Settling into your preferred style and becoming familiar with the nuances of that method may take time, but the incremental improvements players will achieve with practice will result in a noticeable edge over less experienced opponents. 
There's simply one edition of Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare. 
Each copy will include:
1 x Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare Game Board
16 x Rabbit tokens
4 x Brute tokens
16 x Stealth tokens
8 x Aerial tokens
6 x Hero Cards

campaign.story:
I love the end of the night. When someone is about to go home, and I say "How about a game of X before you leave?" They smile and sit down. They can't resist because they know:
The game is fast (like 10 minutes to play)
It's quick to teach (like get started in 30 seconds)
There will be tension and exciting moments
It ends the night on a satisfying note of getting in one more quality game
This game series exists because I want there to be more games like that. We've focused on easy to teach before, but these are SUPER easy to teach.
But there is enough strategy that after the game your mind will wander back to a couple of key turns, and you'll wonder if you should have played just a little bit differently.
And they have those turns...
That turn in GPS where the spinner lands on the spot that helps you but not your opponents. 
That turn in Sequoia where you have to decide if it is worth fighting for the best spot or better to grab multiple spots where there is less competition. 
That turn in Mountain Goats when you bump the leader off the mountain right before they win. 
And Holy Toledo, these games are just $15 each. 
These games were designed for adult gamers, but they are playable with the whole family, including kids as young as 5 with some coaching.  They're also great options when your non-gamer friends ask to play a game, and you want something that you can teach and start playing quickly.
In Mountain Goats you work to move your goats to the top of 6 different mountains where they can score points as long as they stay there. You can share spaces with other goats on the way up, but there is only room for one goat at the top of each mountain. If someone else's goat moves to the mountain top, they will kick you off and you'll have to start your trek over.
It's a game about timing. You need to not just get to the top of the mountain, but get there when no one else is in position to knock you off.
It's a game about keeping your eye on your opponents. Maximizing your score, but also making sure you don't let anyone else score too much.
There is the fun chance to knock each other off the mountain. But it doesn't feel too mean because you can only knock back goats that are in a scoring position, and it isn't a huge setback. It is just a normal part of the cycle of the game.
Read a draft version of the full rulebook for Mountain Goats. 


In Sequoia you are trying to grow the tallest trees in 11 different forests. After your 10 turns, if you have the tallest tree, then you get the victory points from that forest. Second place gets a small consolation prize.
Each turn, you get to grow two of your trees. Which trees you choose will determine if you win or lose. Do you keep fighting in a forest with competition, or start growing your tree somewhere else? You'll have to wrestle with the dice to grow the tree you want.
Sequoia is a game of choosing your battles.
The dice will always give you choices, but they will be hard choices.
Ties in each forest are decided by extra tie-breaker rounds that can lead to epic finishes.
Read a draft version of the full rulebook for Sequoia.

You're launching GPS satellites into space. They need to orbit the earth in the correct order. But your launch windows are limited. You can only launch satellites where the spinner points each turn. It is your job to pick the best satellite for each launch to get your birds in order before your opponents.
GPS is a game about how fun it is to spin that spinner. And it is a very satisfying spin.
It is a game about rooting for the rocket to land on your number.
GPS is a game about putting yourself in a position where the spinner is most likely to help you.
 Read a draft version of the full rulebook for GPS.
You won't be paying for any extra air in your boxes. The games set up big, but they store small. There will always be room to shove one of these into your game bag.
It is a little bit shorter and a little bit wider than a box that holds two decks of cards side by side. It is also about twice as thick so the lid will stay in place much better.
1. For the purpose of shipping, the 3 small games pack (GPS + Sequoia + Mountain Goats) will count as just one game.
2. DO NOT manually increase your pledge amount to cover the shipping cost. It will make both our lives much more complicated when it is time to complete the pledge manager.
3. If you want to pledge for additional games we publish, just manually increase the amount you are pledging. $15 for GPS, Mountain Goats, or Sequoia. $39 for the small games three pack. $34 for On Tour Europe and USA, QE, Bites, or Loot of Lima.
4. Shipping prices will be the same during the pledge manager and you will be able to add more games then at the "additional game" shipping price.  
5. The price of GPS, Mountain Goats, and Sequoia will probably be higher in the pledge manager. We want to offer Kickstarter backers the best possible price.
6. Instead of offering a discount for buying a full case of games, we have steeply discounted the shipping rates for buying additional games. This way you can order the exact number of games your group needs.
7. This campaign is Canadian, EU, UK, and USA, and Australian friendly.
8. There are two main reasons the Canadian and European shipping costs more than US shipping. Since we ship fewer games to these fulfillment centers, it costs us more per game to get them there. And, we have to pay taxes when we bring the games into these regions so that you don't have to pay any taxes when they are delivered to you.
Email help@boardgametables.com if you want to carry one of these games in your Friendly Local Game Store, if you want to offer them through distribution, or if you would like to localize them for your country.
Chad is the owner of BoardGameTables.com and the designer of Sequoia.  Here are some games he loves that aren't getting talked about enough: Blockers, Capital Lux, Factory Funner, The King is Dead, Nations, Greed, Prospectus, Haggis, and Startups.
Katy has to answer all your support emails and messages. So please be nice to her. With a wide range of gaming tastes she can be found playing Lisboa one night and a Harry Potter RPG the next. But it gets a little weird when she role-plays as a wizard during the game of Lisboa.
Anca is the co-artist and graphic designer for On Tour, QE, Bites, and Loot of Lima. She has a poster featured in the Board Game Geek Artist series. Her husband and baby girl are always involved in the projects, from mandatory play testing and prototyping, to artistic suggestions. 
Daniel Profiri is the co-artist for this series. Whenever he's not illustrating board games, he's drawing photorealistic portraits and working on interior design projects. 
Stefan Risthaus is the designer of Mountain Goats. He lives in Northern Germany and likes playing and developing games with history as a theme, but also quick fillers and family games. His wife also designs games and is the first and most important play testing person for his games.
Hartmut Kommerell is the designer of GPS. He has forgotten a lot of the math theory he once studied, but still uses the skills to design games and to puzzle around at work. With a 6-headed family, he can always test games with players of any age.
Estimated delivery January 2021. Our normal math would project a November delivery. We added a couple of extra months because there is a lot of uncertainty right now, and shipping in November/December can add extra delays as everyone else is trying to get stuff in by Christmas.
As with all our Kickstarters, we will fully refund your pledge at any time before we ship the game to you. For any reason. No limits. No restrictions.
Right now some people have some understandable concerns about the health of the economy and small businesses. It is our policy and will continue to be our policy to always keep enough cash on hand to fulfill (produce and ship) all outstanding Kickstarter commitments and preorders.
This is a short campaign, so don't delay.

campaign.story:
Tumble Town is a town and engine building spatial puzzle game for 1-4 players in 45 minutes where each building you construct grants you either a dice manipulation power, engine building skill, one time use ability, or additional scoring conditions. 
Back now to get a free mini expansion with Tumble Town! This offer is only for Kickstarter backers, so don't miss out! 
Watch the Runthrough in the How to Play Section
Everyone knows Tumble Town deserves to be the best town in the West - so it needs a mayor to match! The Tumble Townspeople are hosting a competition to turn the town tootin’ and boomin’! It’s up to you to impress them with your construction and planning skills!
In Tumble Town players are rolling dice, constructing buildings, and competing to make the best town in the West.
 Dice Manipulation & Engine Building: Each building you construct gives you more powers and options. Certain buildings can let you manipulate the dice, making it easier to continue constructing! Other buildings can generate dice or give extra scoring objectives. 
 Spatial Puzzle: Place your constructed buildings along Main Street to create your town. The townspeople want a specific look for the town and if you meet their requirements, you'll gain even more votes from the townspeople!
 Added Scoring Conditions: Construct the right buildings and you can gain more scoring conditions as the game progresses! These can include the size of your constructed buildings, the animals and plants near your constructed buildings, or even the types  of buildings constructed by your neighbors. 
Can you build the best town in the West?
            ULTRA EDITION TIER WOODEN BOX
Ultra Edition Wooden Box Design is Not Finished. Final Version May Look Different.
 Below is a How to Play video:
Rahdo does a Runthrough below: 
Tumble Town Overview
In Tumble Town, you are a mayor trying to best meet the needs of the townspeople by constructing the buildings they desire. Your goal is to have satisfied the townspeople by the time the building materials run out. You make the townspeople happy by constructing buildings, placing the constructed buildings on Main Street in the best formation, and making the townspeople care about other aspects of their town, like the cacti and windmills. 
Each building plan requires certain building materials (die colors) and has restrictions on what die values are needed. 
Each turn goes through a series of four phases: 
1. Claim (take a card)
2. Take Dice + Roll
3. Construct + Use Powers
4. Place + Discard Extra Dice
Claim a Building Plan
You can choose any of the 12 available building plans. You might choose a building plan based on the materials you currently have to build, the benefit that the building gives you when you construct it, the point value, or for the icon it has. 
Take Dice and Roll
You may now take the dice shown on the stack of the cards in the row of the  building plan you choose. 
Construct and Use Powers
Now that you have dice and a building plan, you can construct a building! You may use any of the powers from either your constructed buildings or your horse to help you manipulate your dice into what the building plan requires. 
Place and Discard Extra Dice
Once you construct your building, it's time to place the building on Main Street. You can gain points by matching the criteria on Main Street and you can also get points by making alleys between buildings. 
You may only carry over dice that fit into your Storehouse to your next turn, so if you have more than six, you must choose some to discard back into the supply. 
Game End
Players take turns until the Dice Supply runs out. Once two of the supplies get below two dice, the game end is triggered and all players take an equal amount of turns. 
Scores are tallied and Horses revealed; the player with the most points wins! 
Solo Game
If playing the game solo, you simply choose an Outlaw to play against and start the game! The Outlaw has quick turns and makes the game a race to get the best building materials. There's three difficulties of Outlaw to try and outwit and only the best of the best can win against the Outlaw!
The Solo Missions will give you a point goal and an objective and if you meet it, you move on to the next one. The goals get progressively more difficult as the game goes on.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you've gotten this far, you are seriously considering supporting us and we really appreciate that. We also want you to know that we take this very seriously.

Although we have already successfully funded and delivered multiple projects on Kickstarter, Tumble Town will have it's own unique issues. We would love if everything went smoothly, but we are also trying to be prepared for any problem that could arise.

Tumble Town will be manufactured by a reputable company but international shipping always has the potential for delays and complications.

If things run behind schedule, we think the best approach is to always be up front and communicative with backers. It's our goal to make post-campaign updates part of this experience and we plan to update monthly until the game has shipped to backers in order to keep backers informed of the progress of Tumble Town.

Fulfilled!
If you have not received your game or are missing parts to your game, please submit a help desk ticket here: https://weirdgiraffegames.freshdesk.com/support/tickets/new so we can try and fix your issue.
Expansion Survey

US Shipments
TLDR: Games could be shipped out tomorrow or they could be in fulfillment for an unknown amount of time due to the pandemic / holidays.
So, the games are at the fulfillment company and have been for almost a month. Why are things taking so long? Honestly, we're not sure as every time we've used this fulfillment company, the turnaround time has been close to 3 days. 
However, we've never fulfilled a campaign during the holidays or during a pandemic. Here in the US, COVID cases just keep rising and I assume that is at least partially why fulfillment isn't happening as fast as we have seen in the past. If people are getting sick and not going to work, that can definitely slow things down, especially during the busy shipping season.

US Shipments 
TLDR: Games should be to you as soon as next week, but could be later depending on how long fulfillment takes. 
The games have gone through quite a lot in the last month!

One Harbor, which is going to California. Tracking Link: https://www.marinetraffic.com/en/ais/details/ships/shipid:462669/mmsi:372367000/imo:9302152/vessel:ONE_HARBOUR It was estimated to get to Atlanta on October 25th, but we'll see what happens.

Print and Play

Based on their feedback, we'll clear up anything that went wrong! The goal is to make sure that the game can be learned in the correct way without needing any videos or help from anyone.

https://buttonshygames.com/products/skulls-of-sedlec
Sedlec Ossuary, 16th Century AD.
The Black Plague and Hussite Wars have overcrowded the graveyard. Help the Bone Collector, a half-blind monk, by exhuming graves and arranging the skulls inside the crypt.
You are novice monks, competing to create the best arrangement of skulls. Dig up graves from the graveyard to reveal cards, take cards into your hand to collect skulls, and arrange the cards from your hand into a stack. Whoever better honors the deceased’s last wishes will score more points. The Bone Collector will then declare one player's stack as the most exceptional.
Skulls of Sedlec is a 2-3 player game (with expansions supporting 1 and 4 players), designed by Dustin Dobson with art by Marty Cobb. It was a runner up in Button Shy's 18 Card Challenge to design a game based on a real-life location.
For a complete gameplay overview, check out Dustin's video below: 
To try the game for yourself, the preview PNP (low color, unedited rules) is available now at PNPArcade.com. A small solo preview is there as well. Check it out here: https://www.pnparcade.com/products/skulls-of-sedlec-preview
And if you haven't heard of us before, here are a few quick notes about Button Shy:
We're a small, family based company, with a few helping hands and a great group of designers and artists.
We release a new wallet game every month. This is game #61!
Our wallet games are packaged in a small vinyl wallet for maximum portability.
Each game is hand assembled and mailed from our little workspace in New Jersey.
Enough of what we say about the game, how about some reviews? Here are some links to reviews of Skulls of Sedlec (with some solo reviews in there as well).
https://geekdad.com/2020/03/kickstarter-tabletop-alert-skulls-of-sedlec/
https://whatsericplaying.com/2020/03/09/skulls-of-sedlec/
https://openseatgaming.com/2020/03/13/kickstarter-preview-skulls-of-sedlec/
https://boardsandbees.wordpress.com/2020/03/11/0939/

In previous campaigns we created expansion material and used it as stretch goals. Since 2018, we've just given it away from the start.  So no worries on whether we'll hit it or not, you are getting bonus content if you pledge here. The free expansion for this campaign is the Monstrance expansion. This expansion adds solo play to the game and will retail for $4 after the campaign. 
The Bone Monstrance is one of the ornate sculptures that decorate the inside of the Sedlec Ossuary. As a monk, you will toil away at exhuming graves and arranging skulls into stacks. As an artist though, you will need to be very creative to sculpt a truly original piece that will please the royal family!

This solo expansion celebrates these works of art by allowing you to create six unique features alongside a standard, pyramid-shaped stack of skulls. Each play session adds a condition that will make this undertaking a challenge for even the sharpest skull-stacker!  
Before we look at the rewards, here's a quick introduction to Skulls of Sedlec: Executioners. It's a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.
In life, the Executioner's duty was to protect society by by delivering the death sentence of the condemned. In death, Executioners wish to be surrounded by their handiwork, the abundant skulls of Criminals that they undid. 
This 6-card expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: The deadly Executioner. Punish your opponents and score big by attaching Executioners to groups of Criminals.  Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play. 
And now onto the rewards!

We have a whole bunch of games in our library. 
If you want to add more games to your order, you can do one of two things:
US Backers only - to order games that ship now - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0320impatient" to get 15% off  of your order. Your website order will ship now, as long as you don't order any pre-order items, otherwise the entire order will ship as soon as  everything comes in. As always, if you reach $25.00, you will also receive free shipping.
US Backers only - to order games that ship along with your rewards - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0320us" to get free shipping  on your extra games. These games will all ship together with your Kickstarter rewards.
International Backers only - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and  place an order using the coupon code "0320international" to get free shipping on your extra game(s). Note: The limit on this offer is 3 wallet games (and up to 3 expansions) total, including anything that you order at Kickstarter. Anything above 3 wallet games (and 3 expansions) will end up bumping into the next shipping tier, which can be as much as $10 on international orders. These games will all ship together with your Kickstarter rewards.
A few notable games available in our library are Tussie Mussie, Sprawlopolis and Circle The Wagons.
Dustin Dobson has been fascinated with games for as long as he can remember. As a designer, he’s passionate about crafting fun and memorable experiences that connect people, art, and interactive stories together. With a longtime career as a video game artist and producer, he’s proud to have shipped over a dozen titles, including 2018’s game of the year, God of War.
We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.
It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames,   promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts.... every  month. Supporters will receive from $1, $2, $5 to $10 off of EVERY WALLET GAME THAT WE MAKE. (See the $1 level, that's where the members back the projects).
Our 2020 $5 packages include an episode of Personal Space, a solo game that has multiplayer interactions. It's part roll and write, part campaign, part digital, part real life, part fantasy. There are stickers and everyone receives some unique cards and unique combinations of cards. It's launching very soon, and it's our most ambitious project yet and it will emerge throughout the year.
It also includes Trolling For Trouble by Mike Mullins. In your first month you'll get the 6 card starter kit and then each month after you'll receive a card to expand the game. Trolling For Trouble is a 3+ player bluffing and negotiation game where you play the monsters luring the heroes into battle.
Our $10 packages include all of the above and something extra. Generally it's a tiny game (up to 9 cards), or some expansion / promo cards for our existing games. We have a Sprawlopolis expansion coming in the next few months, and we're working on many more.
And our $20 package includes all of the above and a copy of the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice). The featured wallet games also come with any expansion material that is given away in the Kickstarter campaigns (like the solo expansion here).
If that sounds cool to you, check out the Board Game of the Month Club on Patreon!
http://www.patreon.com/buttonshy

Thank you for checking out Skulls of Sedlec!

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Things have been moving nicely here and most of you should already have your games. We have 234 left (maybe 25% of physical game backers), and we'll be pushing through them over the next week or so. A good chunk of those are custom orders, which take the longest out of everything, but they will be moving forward. 
Otherwise, I hope those that ave received their games are getting them to the table and enjoying them. Skulls of Sedlec is an excellent game and was an above average Kickstarter for us, but I truly believe that once everyone is playing that it'll quickly jump to the top. The multiplayer is excellent and it has a slick little solo mode. Not to play favorites here, but I think this game has the potential to stick around for a while.

Hey everyone, we're well due for a progress update so lets get into it. Hope you don't mind a quick update. I always hold off on an update so I can go all out writing it, but I would assume everyone is ok with a quick and to the point update from time to time?
PNP is coming this week. I have one last file that will be completed today and everything will be sent to our PNP guy. It's usually like a 24 hour process with him, but I know he's travelling so I'm expecting a few days.

Hey everyone, it's time for a quick fulfillment update. We have the cards and wallets here and we just need to wrap up the rules so they can go to the printer. I don't expect they will take too long, so I'd imagine less than two weeks for that. That would put us about 2.5 weeks away from having the print and play, and about 3-4 weeks from having everything here and starting to ship out. 
Let's look at some of the good stuff!

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 
It's time for one of those boring updates - the "things are going as planned, but we have nothing here to show yet" update. It's not my least favorite style though, that's the "things are running late" update. This one is slightly better than that. There's just not much to say! :)
The cards and wallets have been sent off to the printer and we're currently working on the rules. We're also already working on some expansion stuff. This will come out a few months after the game, to give everyone some time to play through and be ready for a new twist. We have more skull types planned, more solo cards planned, and if all goes well, you'll get to see a whole bunch of it.

Hey everyone! It's been a few days since the campaign ended, but I finally had a moment to move on the surveys. Keep an eye on your inboxes as they'll probably show up today. I assume I'm not the only one in this scenario, but being home with the kids is sometimes great, sometimes rough, and sometimes like this week... just straight madness. 
But while I have a moment of quiet (I should probably make sure everything is ok, haha), I wanted to say thanks to everyone. Thanks for supporting another Button Shy game, but thanks for also supporting in a time of such uncertainty. All is well with our production and our sources, but everything is just a little slower. Instead of going to the post office each day, we're going 1-2 times a week. Our local staff is safe at home so my immediate family is helping out a little more than normal.

They came from the Ares System in such a number that our strongest outposts fell in minutes. Soon after, our empire was crushed. Fortunately, on Outpost Titan XII, the experimental fighters, XJ-203, were ready. Now the fate of our entire system rests in the hands of a few daring pilots…this is Galaxy Dice.
Galaxy Dice is an award-winning, 1-4 player, press-your-luck dice game that captures the tense, rapid-fire vertical arcade shooters of the 1980s. Using your newly crafted XJ-203 starfighter, roll the dice to fire your weapons, complete enemy stages, and tackle challenging boss battles! Use game tokens to give you that extra edge, or try a myriad of exciting game modes to intensify the action! Stand with us today!
The Holographic Chroma Ghost Boss Card provides an epic, alternative challenge  for the Galaxy's best pilots. Worth the most points if defeated, this boss requires a collection of different stages to rush and all 7 dice to defeat. Unlock this stretch goal at $7,000. Every backer at the Water Warrior, Lava Commander, XJ-203 Pilot and Nexus Soul pledge level will receive this stretch goal!
The Holographic Phoenix Core card is a Deluxe Edition exclusive expansion! If you explode during your turn (roll 3 explosions) grab the Phoenix Core. If no other players explode (roll 3 explosions) by your next turn, all explosions during your next turn can be re-rolled and you cannot explode (your turn does not end with 3 rolled explosions)! Every backer at the Lava Commander, XJ-203 Pilot and Nexus Soul pledge level will receive this stretch goal if we reach $9,000 in funding!
David Sheppard has designed a thrilling Galaxy Dice Roll n' Write that utilizes the 7 custom-printed Black Ship dice from Galaxy Dice. Every backer at the Desert Wanderer level or higher will receive access to the PnP and will be able to purchase a printed, dry-erase version as an add-on if we reach $11,000 in funding!
A shiny, Holographic upgrade to the Deluxe Edition tin sticker to take your Galaxy Dice tin to the next level! We unlock this stretch goal at $13,000!
The final stretch goal! If we reach $16,000 in funding (which is also 400% of our funding goal!) the Deluxe Edition of Galaxy Dice will have custom-minted Metal Tokens! This is an epic upgrade and we think we can definitely hit this goal!

Hello Backers!

This will likely be our final update for the campaign. I hope you all are enjoying Galaxy Dice as much as we had fun making it! That said, our next Kickstarter campaign has launched and we thought all of you would want to hear about it!

Hello Backers!

I think I can say with confidence that if you are a domestic backer you should have received your pledge by now! If you haven't please let us know! We have also seen some international backers receive their pledges too! If anyone has any questions about what they have received/not received please let us know.

As you know, Galaxy Dice comes in a tin. We started self-manufacturing our games with the Brace for Impact! campaign back in 2017. In every KS campaign we have run we have leveraged the offerings of The Game Crafter in some capacity. We waited until we finished shipping of Galaxy Dice to try something new on The Game Crafter platform. We launched a Crowdsale for another tin game, Fiefdoms!

A word from our designer, David Sheppard:

So, I have a special surprise for our backers…

We launched, the world turned upside down, you backed regardless, and Galaxy Dice became, personally, my most successful game design.  I'm also just now receiving this game during the time when so many of our game nights are cancelled and that really, REALLY sucks.  I want you to enjoy my game and share it with friends who can’t be with you right now.  That’s why it’s up on Tabletopia.

Currently I'm finalizing the storefront, getting it nice and polished before it goes "live" on the store but you don’t have to wait.  They have this feature called Play-Zones, where you can create lobbies and get into the games right away.  With the lobby links, you can invite others and play Galaxy Dice with your friends completely free.  There are even the two versions to play.

Hello Backers!

PACKAGING IS COMPLETE!!!

Hello Backers!

I want to thank you for your patience these past 3 weeks! It has been chaotic to say the least. Good news! Manufacturing is DONE! We got the Ace Pilots in (and they look great!) and we finished all of the Arcade Boxes! Below is a picture of assembly from a while back. That funny looking thing is a SPARE AIR for those of you who aren't SCUBA divers. Had to get a bit creative with weights for gluing.

Hello Backers!
Arcade boxes are almost done! I've painted all of them and have 3 left to glue together! I have also ordered the Custom ACE PILOTS and they are on their way!
Here is my shipping plan. I was able to coordinate travel with Steve (one of the other awesome Rampage Games partners) and he will be coming to Kansas October 15 through 18th to hopefully to help me ship all 350ish packages in one weekend! I really wanted to make sure all of your games went out at the same time. Steve and I will be setting up shop in the baby's room/garage and will hopefully be able to schedule a USPS pick up for that following Monday (October 21st).

Hello Backers!
I am still chugging along with manufacturing. I still have a few arcade boxes to make, but thanks to some help from Amanda, all of the Base Editions are finished! Woohoo!

Hello Backers!
All printed assets are in good shape and accounted for! We purchased some over-sized bins to hold all of it!

Hello Backers!
Let's get right to it. The printed assets order has arrived. I am working my way through the product to 1.) make sure it is all there and 2.) make sure nothing is damaged. The baby's room is currently the resting place for this stuff!

Hello Backers,
We are slowly making progress on the Arcade boxes. With the Kansas heat we are trying to make at least one per day. They take time to get right. We are using superglue for each box. More expensive, but more efficient.

campaign.story:
Due to the success of his Mint making empire in Mintopia City, Mort’s efforts (and market share) have come under attack! Four new mint making companies have noticed the profit potential of Mintopia City and have moved in, in an attempt to dominate the market and make all of the money. Players will take the role of one of four mint making companies and assert their influence over various locations in Mintopia City to secure their loyalties and earn the market share.
Mint Control is designed to provide a small footprint introduction experience to the Area Control and Action Selection genres of gaming that is fun and rewarding for new and seasoned gamers alike.
Set Up
Shuffle the Location Cards, and randomly add Locations to the game area until there are at least 5 Influence Token spaces per player.
                            (10 for 2 players, 15 for 3 players and 20 for 4 players.)
Put the remaining Location cards to the side, they will not be used in this game. Place the 5 Action tiles near the Location cards, this is the Selection Pool.
Place the Mint Tokens near the Location Cards. This forms the Mint Supply, each player then takes 2 Mints from the Supply as their starting currency.
Each player selects a color and takes the 5 Influence Tokens for that color.
The player with the freshest breath starts the game with the Starting Player Token.
Gameplay
Each round, the starting player will select one of the available Action tiles and place it in front of them. They will then perform that Action, followed by the Perk in its entirety.
Then in clockwise order around the table, each other player will perform that same Action (but not the perk) until each player has had the option to perform the Action if able.
After every player has had the option to perform the action chosen by the starting player, the next player in clockwise order will choose one of the remaining available Action Tiles. This process continues until each player has selected one Action tile.
After the final Action has been fully processed, if there are not enough remaining Action tiles for each player to choose from the remaining cards, return all of the chosen Action tiles to the selection pool, so that all Action tiles are available in the next round.
Finally, the Starting Player token passes to the next player in clockwise order, and a new round begins.
Action Tiles
When an action is selected by a player, that player performs both the Action and Perk. Then clockwise around the table each other player performs only the Action.
Influence
The Influence Action allows players to pay Mints to add an Influence Token to an open Influence space. The Perk for selecting this Action reduces the cost to Influence a Location by 1, to a minimum of 0.
Earn
The Earn Action gives players Mints to spend on future turns. The Perk for selecting this Action is to gain an additional Mint.
Presence
The Presence Action grants each player the Presence bonus for each Location where they have Influence. The Perk for this Action is gain the eviction bonus from a Location that the player controls.
Oust
The Oust Action gains each player one Mint, similar to Earn. However, the perk for Oust is to spend 1 Mint to remove any 1 Influence Token from a Location. Then an additional 3 Mints can be spent to remove a second Influence token from a Location. The second token has no additional restrictions, it can be on the same or a different Location, and the same or a different player.
Scavenge
The Scavenge Action does not provide an Action for all players, only the player that selected it. That player can choose to gain 1 Mint from the Supply, or steal 1 Mint from another player.
Win/Lose Conditions 
The game ends at the end of the Action in which at least one player has all 5 of their influence tokens on Locations.
Players gain points for each Location they control. The player with the most points, wins!
In the event of a tie, the player with the most Mints left over wins.
Then, the tied player that has the most Influence placed on locations wins.
Then, the tied player whose age is closest to 42 wins.
PLAYTHROUGH

His second design, Mint Delivery, the Minty Fresh Pick Up and Deliver Game, was a huge Kickstarter success, funding in the first hour, raising almost $200,000, and expanding into the French market. The Mint Universe has become its own licensed IP and we are having more and more industry designers submit designs to join our series. Our vision is to make singular modern board game mechanisms approachable by designing games that are simple to play, easy to teach, and a quick play time.

After much success launching his mint-making company, Mort branched out and provided mints to surrounding towns and regions. Unfortunately, villains from the Dominion of Halitosis  grew jealous of his success, and the Mint Cooperative was launched to protect the citizens of Mintopia from the threat of periodontal peril. With peace restored and the villains defeated, Mort now finds himself threatened by other mint magnates trying to steal his success!  It has been exciting to see characters and locations evolve to have more personality through the games' progression, and it is thrilling to continue the saga in this exciting title.

campaign.story:
It's a game about a tank with knives... what else do you need to know?!
TREAD THROUGH THE BATTLEFIELD and CUT THROUGH YOUR ENEMIES on your way to ULTIMATE VICTORY in KNIFETANK: The SHÜFFLING! Use BOLD MANEUVERS to reach your opponent’s side of the table! Deploy literal CUTTING EDGE WEAPONRY to CRUSH THEIR TANKS and STEAMROLL THEIR DREAMS of victory! BLOW AWAY the competition with SPECIAL CARDS; no two games will be the same!
IT’S ALL IN THE CARDS: everything you need to CUT DOWN THE COMPETITION is right here in the KnifeTank deck! Play 1-on-1, or team up with a friend for FOUR PLAYER ACTION! Select your tank, choose your strategy, slice your way to victory!
How it's played!
(the full rules are available for download here)
Players start each game by picking their favorite KnifeTank cards and placing them on opposing sides of a table. Some tanks, like the Chaos and Classic tank, are more balanced, while others may have faster treads, but shorter reach. Pick the style that's fun for you. 
Each player has a hand of five action cards, which consist of 3 different types of actions: Move, Stab, or Special. There are no turns in KnifeTank, players choose an action card from their hand and simultaneously reveal it. All actions are then resolved.   
Movement
Players move their tanks by placing Movement cards on top of their KnifeTank card. These cards have symbols that indicate the direction and length your KnifeTank card will move. Players aren't allowed to measure Movement cards in advance.  
How to use a Movement Card
Stabbing
On their turn a player may choose to use a Stab card to attack the enemy. Like the movement cards, stab cards are selected in advance without any measuring on the table. Players line the knife card up with the appropriate symbol on their tank. Most cards can be swiveled in any direction, but some can only point forward or backwards. Once a card is laid down, check and see if any part of it overlays on your opponents tank card. If so, "roll" for damage using damage cards indicated in the corner.  
A "hit" happens when your Knife Card overlaps your opponent's tank.
Damage Cards
Whenever a tank is hit, players "roll" for damage using the Damage cards. These cards have different numbers indicating how much damage might be done. Knife and Special cards will indicate which cards should be used when rolling for damage. If a card has a "0 1 1" marked on it, that means the attacker collects a two 1 point damage cards and a 0 card. That player is then allowed to shuffle these in any order they wish then have their opponent select one of the three Damage cards. If the player draws the 0, no damage is done, otherwise they take the damage indicated on the card, "1". Players keep track of their hit points by using the damage tracker. Each tank starts off with the hit points indicated on their tank card. When a tank reaches 0, that player loses. Tanks may never exceed 4 hit points.    
"Rolling" for damage
Special Cards
Mixed in with the Movement and Stab cards are a set of Special cards which can add a fun dexterity element to your game. These cards enable you to toss, drop, or flick cards across the table. One card even allows you to blow cards across the table! 
"And ya know I flick like a missile strike, my precision got you all enraged"
Special cards add a fun element to the game
Stretch Goals
I am dedicated to keeping this project on track, so I don't want to do anything that could cause a delay in shipping or disrupt the game's balance. That being said, I think there are a few cool things we can do if the project reaches these goals:
500- add a "Fish Tank" card to the orders.
1,000 backers- add one more tank and 5 new action cards (1 special, 1 knife, and 3 movement cards)
1,500 backers- foil packaging and an upgraded box
If we reach these goals, I would try to work with my backers here on Kickstarter to collaboratively design these new cards. These new tanks and action cards would not only be made possible through this community, but would be based on feedback from comments and polls as well.

Deep Space D-6: Armada is a stand-alone multi-player sequel to the original solitaire game Deep Space D-6.
In Deep Space D-6: Armada, you and up to 3 friends will work together to complete missions, fight enemy fleets in ship to ship combat, and ultimately defeat an evil federation. 
You'll get stronger as the game progresses, building the perfect starship from over 50 station modules, hiring heroes from a pool of more than 30 unique units, and finding resources to help you dismantle your opposition. 
Armada is a complex and deep game made simple and intuitive through visual and user experience design. If you've played Deep Space D-6 before, you'll be immediately familiar with the mechanics of Armada. If you're new to the series- I hope you're ready for tough decisions and tactical planning! 
Deep Space D-6: Armada is played over a series of game rounds. Each round consists of three phases:

1) Planning: Players perform actions to travel between planets and prepare for upcoming tasks such as upgrading their ships or hiring Heroic crew.
2) Encounter: Players complete Away Missions or combat enemy fleets at their current location (together or alone).
3) Resolution: Event and Threat Detected cards are drawn and hazard effects are resolved. 
 Learn more about the game in upcoming updates:
The Starships (Update #2)
Stations Modules and Weapons (Update #4)
Crew and Special Abilities (Update #6)
Team-Up encounters (Update #8)
Rule Book
Want to know more? Check out the prototype rulebook. This is a work-in-progress rulebook and is subject to change. 
 PHASE 1: Planning
Travel, repair, upgrade ship, hire crew.
PLAY

PHASE 2: Encounter
Ship-to-ship combat and Away Missions.
PLAY

PHASE 3: Resolution 
Draw new event cards, spawn enemies, resolve hazard effects.
PLAY

Creating a science fiction world where the primary color wasn't black proved to be a large challenge. As a lover of classic science fiction, I was drawn to the bright colors and "loudness" of pulp era sci-fi. A true test of Armada's visual direction came from designing the board- or lack thereof. 
A space themed game without the empty blackness of space almost felt wrong, and for some people they probably won't be able to get over it! So Armada uses free floating planet tiles making whatever surface you play on the core color of the "board". Still want that dark sci-fi feel? Play on a neoprene star field map. Want to feel like you're floating in space? Try a glass table! 
For the art, I've enlisted in the help of Gareth Davies. Gareth's unique art style creates a vibrant science fiction world while keeping things minimal and clean. 
For the components themselves, I aimed for a classic board game look with a slight vintage feel. There are over 50 custom dice in this game!  We're taking advantage of new manufacturing technologies, but don't want to go overboard with component gimmicks. 
Get the full game as a $2 add-on!
JUMPSHIP is a hidden identity party game for 5-10 players. You can get a copy of the mini-version for $2 with your Armada pledge. Just add $2 to you pledge. See the update for more info (Not available by itself. Limit 1 copy per copy of Armada).
No stretch goals. Tau Leader Games does not do Kickstarter exclusives. We fully develop our games and don't piece parts out to be added as stretch goals later.
But with your help and community feedback, I've been able to redesign and upgrade the shield and hull trackers! They look like this now:
Other upgrades:
A dedicated solo scenario meant for quicker play.
Custom plastic insert for the hero dice.
Black Core cardstock on all cards.
Drawstring bag for beacon tokens.
Printed player pawns (instead of stickers)
Shipping will be charged after the campaign in the pledge manager. Thanks to the funding progress of this campaign, I've been able to lower shipping rates.
Games will be shipped though fulfillment partners primarily in Canada, China, the EU, the US, and Australia. This should reduce custom fees and VAT. Shipping rates are partially subsidized. 
Backers are limited to 3 total games per pledge. You may add up to 2 additional copies by adding $48 for each additional game to your pledge. There will be no extra shipping charge for extra copies. 
For larger orders (cases of 6+) or retailer pledges, please inquire by sending a message to the creator.
Tabletop games are becoming more and more popular every year. We as consumers (and designers too!) employ platitudes and conjecture comparing the increased complexity and immersion of board games to the capabilities of video games. If we are to make these comparisons, we must also recognize the dangers of any consumer-focused game mediums. Publishers have a responsibility to be morally accountable for any practices that manipulate fans, deceive consumers, or incite misbehavior among those that partake in our hobby. Deceptive pricing schemes, endless boxes of collectible miniatures, nickel & dime expansion structures, undisclosed kickbacks, even player toxicity- these are just a few areas of growing concern within the emerging tabletop industry. Please take a moment to consider how your purchasing habits and use of games reflect on the industry, whether it is my games or someone else's. 
Never forget that tabletop games are a place for communion, self-expression, can have positive effects on our health and mind, and can lead to wonderful careers and societal impact. As an independent publisher I'm committed to creating games that respect players, and delivering them with practices that are healthy for the community. 
Have fun and play nice. 
Join the Armada today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Deep Space D-6: Armada is my most ambitious and largest game to date. Though the game is already designed, we continue to balance and add new features. There is also a non-trivial amount of art assets to be completed. These things will take time. 

This will be my 6th Kickstarter game project. I've been all over the place- let me tell you. From last-second funding escapades to projects far exceeding my own projections and everything in between. This means I've also seen failures and made mistakes. I've been late to hit deadlines. I've been unresponsive when I needed communication the most. I take full responsibility for my actions and hope people will be fair in judgement and understanding. I am fully aware that being an individual does not necessitate leniency in a market full of large companies and publishers with impressive capabilities. Let's just do our best to be reasonable and keep the spirit of independent self-publishing alive!

TauLeaderGames has a 100% delivery rate but every project still has inherent risks. October 2020 is my best estimate for a project of this scope based on my past experience. While this timeframe includes room for errors and overages, it doesn't encapsulate every possible obstacle. It is important to note that I would rather delay a game to make it better, than to ship a low-quality product.
